result.execSummary:
The defendant Hope Marie Olmo Guzman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Any other sentence currently serving
Consecutive to: Any other sentence currently serving.

miscConds.notes: Payment of costs and DNA surcharge = $518.00 - payment to be taken from bond on deposit

Not allowed to vote or serve on jury until civil rights are restored.  No possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances illegal in WI today without a valid prescription.  Must take any medications as prescribed for Mental Health or Substance Abuse.  May not take Suboxone or methadone - may only take vivitrol.
All conditions of probation already serving on Outagamie County Case.  AODA evaluation and follow through.  Mental health evaluation and follow through.  DNA sample due 10-17-2022.
